keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt from Washington; Gardiner Harris from Hanoi, Vietnam; and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: President Obama described Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour’s death as an “important milestone,” but it also illustrated the tangled relationship between Washington and Islamabad.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Strike on Taliban Leader Is Seen as a Message to Pakistan
headline.main: U.S. Strike on Taliban Leader Is Seen as a Message to Pakistan

snippet: President Obama described Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour’s death as an “important milestone,” but it also illustrated the tangled relationship between Washington and Islamabad.
abstract: United States drone strike in Pakistan that killed Afghan Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour serves as signal to Pakistan to begin to take peace process seriously; officials are unsure whether Mansour's death will increase incentives for Taliban to go to bargaining table or splinter group’s leadership.
